casebody.data:
Nies
v.
Town of Emerald Isle 409PA15-1 Supreme Court of North Carolina. May 25, 2016

J. David Breemer, Attorney at Law, Keith P. Anthony, Attorney at Law, Durham, For Nies, Gregory P., et al.

Brian E. Edes, Attorney at Law, Wilmington, Norwood P. Blanchard, III, Attorney at Law, For Town of Emerald Isle.

Elliot M. Engstrom, Attorney at Law, For Civitas Institute Center for Law and Freedom.

Stephanie H. Autry, Attorney at Law, George B. Autry, Jr., Attorney at Law, Raleigh, Robert H. Thomas, Attorney at Law, Pro Hac Vice, For Owners' Counsel of America, et al.

The following order has been entered on the motion filed on the 23rd of May 2016 by Civitas Institute Center for Law and Freedom for leave to file Amicus Curiae Brief:

"Motion Allowed by order of the Court in conference, this the 25th of May 2016."

Unless already submitted, the Amicus Brief shall be submitted to the court within the times allowed and in the manner provided by Appellate Rule 28(i).
